page_content:
The ceremonial opening of the Museum of Computer Science was performed *on November 10, 2011* *year* by the Dean of the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science - *Dr. Andrzej Rozkosz, Prof. UMK* and the long-time head of the Computer System Exploitation Laboratory - *Dr. Andrzej Kurpiel*.
The collected exhibits mostly date from 1980-2000, but there are some older and newer ones among them. Many of the exhibits have been received by the Museum as donations from employees and students of the Department, from private collections.
Work on the establishment of the Computer Science Museum lasted from August 2010 to December 2011. The work involved the staff of the Computer System Operations Laboratory supported by the Faculty students who were among the administrators. They consisted of completing, cleaning and preparing for display equipment that was withdrawn from use many years ago.
The exhibit includes equipment such as personal computers, laptops, servers, network devices, printers, copiers, terminals, calculators, computer components and accessories.
Recently, a room with a "retro-style Internet cafe" and an interactive presentation of 8-bit and 16-bit computers has been prepared. The launch of the room took place on April 21, 2012, during an event held at the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science as part of the next edition of the Science and Arts Festival.

page_content: We would like to thank the "Energopomiar" Power Engineering Measurement and Research Establishments "Energopomiar" Sp. z o.o. of Gliwice for donating a number of IT publications, mainly from the 1970s, to the Museum of Computer Science. They significantly expand the collection of books gathered at the Museum.
